text: The voiced velar stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨g⟩`. The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by the "g" in gear and grow. == Features == See also: Voiced uvular lateral fricative ==Examples== Language Word IPA Meaning Abkhaz /ažyga 'shovel' Adyghe Shapsug /g'ègwal"è 'toy' Temirgoy / č"ygy 'tree' Albanian 'donkey' Arabic Moroccan /'agaadiir 'Agadir' Tunisian /gafs'a 'Gafsa' Hejazi /gamar 'moon' Najdi Sa'idi Yemeni /gaal '(he) said' /gamal 'camel' Egyptian /raagel 'man' Armenian Eastern /ganç 'treasure' Assyrian ܓܢܐ 'self' Azerbaijani 'black' Basque 'lose' Bengali গান/gan 'song' Bulgarian гора/gora 'forest' Catalan 'glove' Chinese Southern Min 我/ góa 'I' Wu 狂/ woã 'crazy' Xiang 共/ wong 'together' Chechen /govr 'horse' Czech 'gram' Dutch All dialects 'tissue' Standard Many speakers goal 'goal' Amelands goëd 'good' English 'gaggle' Esperanto 'tasty' Filipino 'commotion' French 'earnings' Georgian /guli 'heart' German 'lie' Greek / 'donkey's bray' Gujarati /gāvu 'to sing' Hebrew /gav 'back' Hindustani / 'song' Hungarian 'permission' Irish 'sand' Italian 'competitions' Japanese / 'overcoat' Kabardian Baslaney / k'anė 'shirt' Kagayanen 'spirit' Khmer / 'gas' Korean / 'catfish' Lithuanian garai 'steam' Macedonian /grom 'thunder' Malay 'sack' Marathi 'grass' Nepali 'village' Norwegian 'gold' Odia ଗଛ/gacha 'tree' Persian گوشت/gušt 'meat' Polish 'plebs' Portuguese 'tongue' Punjabi ਗਾਂ/gaa 'cow' RomanianDEX Online : 'thought' Russian /golova 'head' Serbo-Croatian / 'guest' Slovak 'lymph' Somali 'to shorten' Spanish 'cat' Swahili 'darkness' Swedish 'tasty' Turkish 'epidemic' Ukrainian /g̀anok 'porch' Welsh gwyn [ɡwɪn] or [ɡwɨ̞n] 'white' West Frisian 'buckle' (n.)
